title: Ticket #6525: Remove all rewriting of sinful strings in ads going on the wire
description:
In old versions of HTCondor, daemons would rewrite their sinful string in ads going on the wire to reflect the interface being used. As part of the IPv6 work in 8.3.x, this code was largely disabled (#5074). But a variant of it was kept for HTConndor-CE (#4849). This variant, controlled by SHARED_PORT_ADDRESS_REWRITING, was "born deprecated". I believe this feature can now be removed entirely.

Removing the rewriting code should negatively affect only clients of HTCondor-CE that are older than 8.3.x and are IPv6-only. This seems like a very unlikely set of conditions today.
